definition: Shizhoupian, early school primer in great seal script 大篆[da4 zhuan4], attributed to King Xuan of Zhou 周宣王[Zhou1 Xuan1 wang2] but probably dating from c. 500 BC
surname Shi
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
surname Zhou
(writing)/to develop/seal script used throughout the pre-Han period
sheet/piece of writing/bound set of bamboo slips used for record keeping (old)/classifier for written items: chapter, article
seal script used throughout the pre-Han period

Six Methods of forming Chinese characters, according to Han dictionary Shuowen 說文|说文 - namely, two primary methods: 象形 (pictogram), 指事 (ideogram), two compound methods: 會意|会意 (combined ideogram), 形聲|形声 (ideogram plus phonetic), and two transfer methods: 假借 (loan), 轉注|转注 (transfer)
seal script used throughout the pre-Han period
the small or lesser seal, the form of Chinese character standardized by the Qin dynasty
character book (i.e. school primer)

Three Commentaries on the Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], including Mr Gongyang's annals 公羊傳|公羊传[Gong1 yang2 Zhuan4], Mr Guliang's annals 穀梁傳|谷梁传[Gu3 liang2 Zhuan4] and Mr Zuo's annals or Zuo Zhuan 左傳|左传[Zuo3 Zhuan4]

Longkan Shoujian, Chinese character dictionary from 997 AD containing 26,430 entries, with radicals placed into 240 rhyme groups and arranged according to the four tones, and the rest of the characters similarly arranged under each radical
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
pre-Qin, Chinese history up to the foundation of the Qin imperial dynasty in 221 BC
to explain/to interpret/interpretation
the great seal/used narrowly for 籀文/used broadly for many pre-Qin scripts
Bamboo Annals, early chronicle of Chinese ancient history, written c. 300 BC
variant of 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1]
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
inscription in bronze/bell-cauldron inscription
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
